column4: hi guys, i have just installed the aTI prpietary driver, and it slowdown my computer too much
can anyone help?
-> umm wouldnt you just remove and de-install to cleanse of such driver?
- i have already done that
- any idea, please? (you or anyone else)
-> you have verified the modules or driver has been removed or de-installed? what command you used to verify?
- i followed steps from here -> https://a248.e.akamai.net/f/674/9206/0/www2.ati.com/drivers/linux/linux_cat91-inst.pdf
-> am not going to read just because you post the link.. tell us exactly what you have done..
- "With superuser permissions, enter the command "sh ./fglrx-uninstall.sh" "
-> now look inside that script to see if it really removed it, or use  lsmod to verify
-> also it seems you are trying to use an rpm package?
- lsmod shows the module installed, but because im using it right now
-> but you claimed you have un-installed it, so which one is it?
-> well if your claim it slows you down, why not remove it so you can see the difference afterwards?
- okay, i will uninstall now, be back in minutes
- okay, i uninstalled modules, verifyed by "lsmod | grep fglrx"
-> okay, how is the perf now?
- seems to be quite good, normal
- .... and now? :)
-> if you are happy with the speed, -- if aint borked..dont mess with it?  :P
- lol , well, i would agree i i could play games without 3D
-> sorry im not a gamer, cant assist you much with 3D drivers
